alert.note: Alert for Broome (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 18 at 10:28AM EST until December 20 at 2:30PM EST by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in New York...Pennsylvania... Susquehanna River At Binghamton Washington Street affecting Broome County. Susquehanna River At Waverly/Sayre affecting Bradford and Tioga Counties. Susquehanna River At Bainbridge affecting Chenango and Delaware Counties. Susquehanna River At Unadilla affecting Otsego and Delaware Counties. Susquehanna River Near Windsor affecting Broome County. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in New York...Pennsylvania... Susquehanna River At Owego affecting Tioga County. Susquehanna River At Towanda affecting Bradford County. Susquehanna River Near Wilkes-Barre affecting Luzerne County. Susquehanna River At Meshoppen affecting Wyoming County. Susquehanna River At Vestal affecting Broome and Tioga Counties. Susquehanna River At Conklin affecting Susquehanna and Broome Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT TO EARLY WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Susquehanna River near Windsor. * WHEN...From late tonight to early Wednesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 18.0 feet, Residential basement flooding occurs on Bridge Street. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:30 AM EST Monday the stage was 12.6 feet. - Bankfull stage is 11.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late tonight to a crest of 18.0 feet tomorrow evening. It will then fall below flood stage Wednesday morning. - Flood stage is 17.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 1030 PM EST.
